message.content:
cs.HC, cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.SI 

This paper focuses on analyzing online reviews to capture changes in user expectations over time, which is a common topic in human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also uses natural language processing techniques to identify and structure product affordances, which falls under information retrieval (cs.IR) and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Additionally, the conjoint analysis method used to categorize the structured affordances is a common technique in marketing research (cs.CY). Finally, the paper's focus on using online reviews as a source of data for product improvement strategies could also fall under social and information sciences (cs.SI).
